prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Suzanne, Stefan's wife, be travelling to Edward's lake house in Michigan, when Stefan makes the trip in August 2025?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical list of all relevant horary chart data based strictly on traditional horary principles for your query:

1. Planetary Positions (with degree positions and signs):
 • Sun – 16°20′ Aquarius
 • Moon – 10°49′ Taurus
 • Mercury – 12°59′ Aquarius
 • Venus – 0°25′ Aries
 • Mars – 19°23′ Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter – 11°16′ Gemini
 • Saturn – 17°51′ Pisces
 • Uranus – 23°16′ Taurus
 • Neptune – 28°4′ Pisces
 • Pluto – 2°10′ Aquarius
 • North Node – 29°38′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron – 19°37′ Aries
 • Ascendant – 6°7′ Leo
 • MC – 22°4′ Aries
 • IC – 22°4′ Libra

2. Major Aspects (with orb indications):
 • Mars square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • MC opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Neptune conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus conjunct North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Mercury trine Jupiter (orb: 1°)
 • Venus sextile Pluto (orb: 2°)
 • Moon square Mercury (orb: 2°)
 • Venus conjunct Neptune (orb: 2°)
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Sun sextile Chiron (orb: 3°)
 • Mars square IC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars square MC (orb: 3°)
 • Chiron opposition IC (orb: 3°)
 • Chiron conjunct MC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Moon square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Pluto opposition Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Sun conjunct Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Jupiter sextile Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Sun trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Sun sextile MC (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Sun square Moon (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury opposition Ascendant (orb: 6°)
 • Venus trine Ascendant (orb: 6°)
 • Sun trine IC (orb: 6°)
 • Sun square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 • Neptune trine Ascendant (orb: 8°)

3. Patterns and Configurations:
 • T-Square 1: Involving MC in 22° Aries, Mars in 19° Cancer, IC in 22° Libra, with Chiron at 19° Aries playing a key role
 • T-Square 2: Involving Ascendant in 6° Leo, Moon in 10° Taurus, and Mercury in 12° Aquarius
 • The chart shows a predominance of Square and Sextile aspects (total count = 8)
 • Fixed mode dominates among the inner planets
 • Notable placements: Sun, Mercury, and Pluto are descending; Chiron sits on the Midheaven, and the IC is exactly on the Nadir
 • The Moon is in its waxing crescent phase and the overall chart forms a Bowl shape

4. House Placements (using provided house boundaries):
 • 1st House (Ascendant): Starts at 6° Leo
 • 2nd House: Starts at 28° Leo
 • 3rd House: Starts at 21° Virgo
 • 4th House: Starts at 22° Libra
 • 5th House: Starts at 2° Sagittarius
 • 6th House: Starts at 9° Capricorn – Contains Pluto
 • 7th House: Starts at 6° Aquarius – Contains Sun and Mercury
 • 8th House: Starts at 28° Aquarius – Contains Saturn
 • 9th House: Starts at 21° Pisces – Contains Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron
 • 10th House: Starts at 22° Aries – Contains Moon and Uranus
 • 11th House: Starts at 2° Gemini – Contains Jupiter
 • 12th House: Starts at 9° Cancer – Contains Mars

5. House Cross-Reference Relevant to the Query:
 • You are signified by the Ascendant (1st House).
 • Stefan is represented by his 9th house; per the provided cross-reference, the Ascendant’s 6th House corresponds to Stefan’s 9th. Here, notice Pluto is in the 6th House.
 • Additional attention should be given to houses governing travel and foreign connections (9th and its related aspects).

6. Special Observations:
 • Neptune in Pisces is in its rulership, reinforcing its prominence in the 9th House.
 • The interplay of Venus and Neptune (both in the 9th House) suggests matters connected to feelings, journeys, or travel dynamic influences.
 • The T-Square configuration involving the MC, IC, Mars, and Chiron may indicate tension specifically linked to domestic versus outer-world travel themes.

The above data is extracted strictly from horary principles and will serve as the factual basis for further interpretation.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The horary chart indicates a duality in travel influences for Suzanne. In the 9th-house sector—with Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron—the energies favor travel and international or distant movement. Venus conjunct Neptune and North Node supports the idea of a journey initiated with a positive intent. However, the presence of tension from Mars square Chiron and a T‑Square configuration involving the MC, IC, and Mars signals potential obstacles. Pluto’s placement in the 6th house (signifying Stefan’s 9th-house matters) and its opposition to the Ascendant further emphasize that transformative, possibly disruptive factors may interfere. Saturn’s influence in the adjacent 8th house suggests delays or restrictions, pointing to a journey that may be initiated but with complications, unexpected delays or last‑minute changes.

Based on these elements, the chart suggests that Suzanne will indeed set out toward Edward’s lake house in Michigan. Nevertheless, the journey is marked by significant challenges and disruptions, meaning that her travel may not proceed as smoothly or as predictably as hoped.
swipes:

Saturn’s influence in the adjacent 8th house suggests delays or restrictions, pointing to a journey that may be initiated but with complications, unexpected delays or last‑minute changes.

Based on these elements, the chart suggests that Suzanne will indeed set out toward Edward’s lake house in Michigan. Nevertheless, the journey is marked by significant challenges and disruptions, meaning that her travel may not proceed as smoothly or as predictably as hoped.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusts my shawl and peers intently at the chart again

My dear, I must revise my interpretation. The chart actually shows quite clearly that Suzanne will NOT be traveling to Edward's lake house with Stefan in August 2025.

The key indicators are:
- Mars retrograde in Cancer in the 12th house (hidden matters, secrets)
- The T-Square between Mars, MC/IC axis, and Chiron suggests internal conflict and tension around home/family matters
- Pluto's opposition to your Ascendant from Stefan's 9th house indicates a definitive separation or break in travel plans
- Saturn in the 8th house forms challenging aspects that point to restrictions and limitations

The presence of Venus-Neptune conjunction in the 9th could initially give false hope or unclear communications about the trip. However, the stronger testimonies from Mars retrograde and the T-Square configuration firmly indicate that Suzanne will remain separate from this journey.

This reading is far more aligned with the actual chart data than my previous interpretation. The aspects speak clearly of a division or separation rather than unified travel plans.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, madam. That aligns quite perfectly with other charts that show they will be filing for divorce in early March.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
leans forward with keen interest, her bangles jingling softly

Ah yes,  touches the chart thoughtfully Now I see why Mars retrograde speaks so strongly of separation. The aspects show not just physical distance, but a severing of bonds. The T-Square's tension points directly to domestic upheaval.

traces the aspect lines with her bejeweled finger

The Saturn placement is particularly telling - it speaks of endings, dear. And with Pluto opposing your Ascendant from Stefan's 9th house sector, we're seeing a complete transformation of their connection. The divorce filing in March makes perfect sense with these planetary positions.

Would you like me to look deeper into the timing aspects around March? There might be additional insights about how this separation process unfolds.
